org.lisoft.gonector

Interface GoEngine


  • public interface GoEngine
    This interface specifies an API for a Go robot that can be interfaced through GTP.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addMove(Move aMove, Player aPlayer)
      Add a move to the current game state.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The identity of the robot.
      java.lang.String getVersion()
      The version number of the robot.
      void newGame()
      Starts a new game, the robot should clear its internal state to a new game.
      Move nextMove(Player aPlayer)
      Asks the robot for the next move for the given player.
      boolean resizeBoard(int aSize)
      This method is called when the board size changes.
      void setKomi(float aKomi)
      Inform the robot about the komi value for the game.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The identity of the robot.
        Returns:
        A string with the name of the robot. May contain spaces, should not contain version number. Must be ASCII only.

      • getVersion

        java.lang.String getVersion()
        The version number of the robot.
        Returns:
        A string encoding the version number. Must be ASCII only.

      • resizeBoard

        boolean resizeBoard(int aSize)
        This method is called when the board size changes. The robot may return false if it doesn't support the given board size. The Go Text Protocol mandates that this is called at least once before the first call to newGame().
        Parameters:
        aSize - A positive integer larger than zero.
        Returns:
        true if the board size is supported, false otherwise.

      • newGame

        void newGame()
        Starts a new game, the robot should clear its internal state to a new game.

      • setKomi

        void setKomi(float aKomi)
        Inform the robot about the komi value for the game.
        Parameters:
        aKomi - The new komi value, any value is allowed.

      • addMove

        boolean addMove(Move aMove,
                Player aPlayer)
        Add a move to the current game state. This can be used to play the game to a certain state or to inform the robot of the opponents move. In either case the robot should update its internal state. The robot may veto the move if it is invalid.
        Parameters:
        aMove - The position to add a stone to.
        aPlayer - The colour of the stone.
        Returns:
        true if the move was legal, false otherwise.

      • nextMove

        Move nextMove(Player aPlayer)
        Asks the robot for the next move for the given player.
        Parameters:
        aPlayer - The player that a move should be constructed for.
        Returns:
        The move the robot would like to play.
